title: The PULLBACK Is ALMOST OVER!! These Altcoins Will RALLY NEXT!!

chunks.text: What's up, guys? It's Dan from Coinb Trading. Today, we're going to talk about why the small pullback is almost over and which altcoins you should be watching when the crypto market continues powering higher. This is the kind of content that you enjoy. Then, be sure to smash that like button, subscribe to the channel, and ping that notification bell. Before we get started, do keep in mind that nothing in this video is financial advice. It's just my personal analysis of the crypto market. Your analysis could be different, and if it is, that's awesome because the more difference of opinion that we have, the better traders and the better investors we're all going to become. So, I want to start off guys with a throwback to the video that I did on Monday where I had actually specified that my base case was a small pullback in the coming days because of course the crypto market had been going up I think for around six days uh straight at that point. A standard pullback was of course expected. You can check this again this video on Monday January 5th and literally the title of that section is small pullback as base case. I probably should have mentioned that in yesterday's video about Ethereum exploding higher because of course the moment I posted that video then we got that pullback and everyone's saying oh you're wrong. You're wrong. But it doesn't change the fact that I do think Ethereum is going to explode higher. Uh and again later on in the video, we'll take a look at which altcoins could benefit. Uh not just just not just Ethereum, but other altcoins later in the video, as well as why as to why there was a small pullback or why that pull that small pullback was likely. Of course, it had to do with the CME gap on Bitcoin, which has been filled at the time of shooting, at least the first CME gap here that was left over the weekend. Uh what's really interesting, guys, is that this second CME gap here that's down lower around 88,100. Uh this CME gap basically happened over New Year's and for those of you guys who don't know the reason why these CME gaps are closed, it's it doesn't have anything to do with emotions. It doesn't have anything to do with traders. It has to do it's basically a mechanical uh thing that's related to an inst well I guess technically a trade it's related to an institutional trade. Basically a basis trade where institutions are basically trading on the CME and using a spot Bitcoin ETFs. And one thing that I mentioned on Monday that's kind of interesting is that it's possible that this uh first CME gap here uh that you know this lower CME gap here around 88,100 it's possible that it won't be closed because it's possible that the dynamics for CME gaps over holidays are different than the dynamics over weekends. With that being said, I should note that officially, you know, like basically the textbook explanation of CME gaps is that it doesn't matter uh if they happen over a weekend or over a holiday day. Uh those CME gaps still get closed regardless. Uh and of course that would be kind of consistent with the target that I had specified in Monday's video that we would see uh Bitcoin, Ethereum and most cryptos fall back uh to uh basically retest the uh the daily Ballingerband moving average here which is currently around 89,100 to see a little bit of a deviation below that to fill that CME gap for Bitcoin would be completely normal and that would be a standard small pullback in an otherwise uh you know continued uptrend which has arguably been uh in in progress since the end of December. Uh similar idea here for Ethereum. There was no CME gap over the weekend, which is pretty interesting. But of course, there is a CME gap still down here from uh from January 1st. You can see the CME gap is currently somewhere around 3,000. If we look at Ethereum uh on the daily chart, you can see that a pullback for ETH back to the daily Ballinger band moving average would be around 3,000, which again is consistent with what I had mentioned in this video on Monday. So again, maybe another small pullback later today. Still possible. Whether it happens or it doesn't, I don't think it changes the fact that crypto prices are going to be going higher. And also I guess uh also to address the elephant in the room here. ETHBTC had been pointing that out yesterday.
